description: Merged PRINCE2 v7 Foundation questions with answers and rationales from provided PDFs. | cleaned: removed Thought Agile attribution text; removed syllabus_ref for Sample Paper 1 & 2

questions.question: Which statement describes the project context?

options.A: It should be understood by stakeholders so that the principles are applied appropriately
options.B: It explains how each aspect of project management should be applied for the processes to be effective
options.C: It guides the progression from pre-project activity through the stages of the project lifecycle
options.D: It ensures an understanding of the needs of stakeholders, and the relationships between them

questions.correct_answer_text: It should be understood by stakeholders so that the principles are applied appropriately
questions.rationale: A. Correct. The project context is one of the five integrated elements of PRINCE2 Project Management. It influences how “the principles, practices and processes are applied by the people involved to ensure that the method is fit for the project context”. Ref 1.2 B. Incorrect. The PRINCE2 Project Management practices “describe essential aspects of project management that must be applied consistently and throughout the project lifecycle. The seven practices explain the specific treatment required of that aspect of project management for the PRINCE2 Project Management processes to be effective and why they are necessary”. Ref 1.2 C. Incorrect. “The seven processes describe the entire project lifecycle, from activities before getting started, through the stages of project delivery, and to the final act of project closure. Each process has checklists of recommended activities and related responsibilities.” Ref 1.2 D. Incorrect. The ‘people’ element covers “those working on the project and those affected by the project. An understanding of the needs, capabilities and motivations of the people involved and the relationships between them is crucial to how the project is established and managed”. Ref 1.2

questions.question: Which is a characteristic of a project that distinguishes it from business as usual?

options.A: Projects continue after business-as-usual resumes B. It is the set of shared attitudes, values, and goals for the project
options.B: Projects include ongoing management of operations C. It is a control that takes place when a specific event occurs
options.C: Every project will be different to previous projects D. It is instructing the execution of tasks in line with agreed ways of working
options.D: Project work is generally less risky than business-as-usual work

questions.correct_answer_text: Every project will be different to previous projects D. It is instructing the execution of tasks in line with agreed ways of working
questions.rationale: A. Incorrect. “Projects are temporary in nature. When the desired change has been implemented, BAU resumes (in its new form), and the need for the project is removed.” Ref 1.3 B. Incorrect. “Projects are temporary in nature. When the desired change has been implemented, BAU resumes (in its new form), and the need for the project is removed.” Ref 1.3 C. Correct. “Every project is unique […], but each one will differ in a certain way. This can mean a different team, customer, supplier, product, location, or timeframe. All these factors combine to make every project unique.” Ref 1.3 D. Incorrect. The uncertainty associated with projects makes them riskier than business as usual. “The characteristics already listed will introduce threats and opportunities over and above those typically encountered within BAU. Projects are riskier than any operational aspects of an organization.” Ref 1.3 PRINCE2® Project Management Foundation | Sample Paper 1 Answers and Rationales | Copyright © PeopleCert International Limited 3 Q A Syllabus Ref Rationale

questions.question: The project board has decided that the project should close prematurely as the external environment has changed. Which principle is being applied?
questions.rationale: A. Incorrect. Incorporating lessons through the project relates to the ‘learn from experience’ principle. “A PRINCE2 Project Management project team actively seeks, records, and implements improvements as a result of relevant lessons learned from prior projects and throughout the life of the project. It applies them in future projects and shares them for others to apply.” Ref 2.2 B. Incorrect. Adapting PRINCE2 Project Management to a specific project relates to the ‘tailor to suit the project’ principle. “PRINCE2 Project Management is applied and tailored to suit the project environment, size, complexity, importance, delivery method, team capability and level of risk.” Ref 2.7 C. Incorrect. Defining tolerances for project performance relates to the ‘manage by exception’ principle. “A PRINCE2 Project Management project establishes limits of delegated authority by defining tolerances for performance against its plans.” Ref 2.5 D. Correct. Organizations that lack rigour in business justification may find that projects proceed even when there are few real benefits or when a project has only tentative associations with the business strategy. “The business justification drives decision-making to ensure that the project remains aligned with the benefits sought and contributes to business objectives.” This is the ‘ensure continued business justification’ principle. Ref 2.1

options.A: It should be understood by stakeholders so that the principles are applied A. They allow the project team to decide how the method should be applied on the appropriately project
options.B: It explains how each aspect of project management should be applied for the B. They take into account industry-specific models as PRINCE2 Project Management is processes to be effective generic
options.C: It guides the progression from pre-project activity through the stages of the project C. They rely on a common vocabulary that should be applied as defined in PRINCE2 lifecycle Project Management
options.D: It ensures an understanding of the needs of stakeholders, and the relationships D. They should be applied in the same way across projects within an organization between them

questions.correct_answer_text: It should be understood by stakeholders so that the principles are applied A. They allow the project team to decide how the method should be applied on the appropriately project
questions.rationale: A. Correct. The principles guide how PRINCE2 Project Management can be tailored to best fit a project and its context. “To enable PRINCE2 Project Management to be used for such a wide range of projects, the method is flexible in how it can be used for any given project. Rather than prescribing what to do to align the method to the specific project, PRINCE2 Project Management offers guidance through principles.” Ref 2 B. Incorrect. “PRINCE2 Project Management’s strength is its flexibility and the fact that it is not specific to a particular industry, type of project, commercial model, project lifecycle, delivery method, product development, or engineering practice.” In addition, “how the method is applied and tailored depends on the nature of the project and factors internal and external to the business”. These would include industry- specific models. Ref 1.1.1.1,2 C. Incorrect. It is true that PRINCE2 Project Management is “widely recognized and provides a common vocabulary for all participants, which encourages consistency and the ability to reuse project assets, facilitate staff mobility, and reduce the impact of personnel changes or handovers”. However, PRINCE2 Project Management terminology may need to be tailored to suit a specific project. In general, it may be necessary to tailor the PRINCE2 Project Management terminology to what is common in the company or in the industry in which the project is taking place. “It may also involve adjusting the terminology to match terms used by the organizations involved.” Ref 1.6, 2.7 D. Incorrect. “To enable PRINCE2 Project Management to be used for such a wide range of projects, the method is flexible in how it can be used for any given project. Rather than prescribing what to do to align the method to the specific project, PRINCE2 Project Management offers guidance through principles.” This means that they are likely to be applied in different ways across projects within an organization. Ref 2

questions.question: Which management product should the project board approve to commit to the project scope and timescale?
questions.rationale: A. Incorrect. “In PRINCE2 Project Management, the trigger for the project is referred to as the project mandate. This is provided by the responsible authority from the business that is commissioning the project.” Ref 13.3 B. Incorrect. “The purpose of the benefits management approach is to define the benefits management actions and benefits reviews that will be established to ensure that the project’s outcomes are achieved and to confirm that the project’s benefits are realized.” Ref 5.5 C. Correct. “The project initiation documentation gives the direction and scope of the project and (along with the stage plan) forms the ‘contract’ between the project manager and the project board.” Ref 4.3.1 D. Incorrect. The business case is used “to document the business justification for undertaking a project”. Ref 5.5

questions.question: What is a purpose of the business case practice?

options.A: To enable the project executive to decide whether to continue with the project B. Project executive
options.B: To identify the user’s quality expectations to meet the business need C. Project management team
options.C: To prevent the planned outcomes from causing dis-benefits to the business D. Project board
options.D: To define the products and how they will be delivered to satisfy the business case

questions.correct_answer_text: To enable the project executive to decide whether to continue with the project B. Project executive
questions.rationale: A. Correct. “The purpose of the business case practice is to establish mechanisms to judge whether the project is (and remains) desirable, viable, and achievable as a means to support decision-making in its continued investment.” Ref 5.1 B. Incorrect. “The purpose of the quality practice is to document the user’s requirements of the project products and to establish the means by which they will be met.” “The purpose of the business case practice is to establish mechanisms to judge whether the project is (and remains) desirable, viable, and achievable as a means to support decision-making in its continued investment.” Ref 8.1, 5.1 C. Incorrect. “PRINCE2 Project Management projects deliver outputs in the form of products which are used to facilitate changes in an organization or for organizations. These changes create capabilities that lead to outcomes. The outcomes allow the organization(s) to realize the benefits that are explained in the business case for the project. Outcomes that are perceived as negative by one or more stakeholders may result in dis- benefits.” It is not a purpose of the business case practice to prevent dis-benefits, more to identify and manage them. Ref 5.1 D. Incorrect. “The purpose of the plans practice is to facilitate communication and control by defining the products to be delivered (the ‘what’) and the means to deliver them (the ‘who’, the ‘how’, the ‘where’, and estimates of the ‘when’ and for ‘how much’) to satisfy the project business case (the ‘why’).” It is the business case practice that justifies investment in a project. Correct. “The purpose of the plan is to provide a proposal that outlines the what, where, when, how, and by whom the project as a whole (or a subset of its activities) will be performed.” This refers to all types of plan (project, stage, team and exception plans). ”When a project or stage exceeds (or is anticipated to exceed) an agreed tolerance, a project manager will raise an exception report to the project board” and “if the forecast is for project tolerances to be exceeded, the project board no longer has the authority to direct the project and must refer the matter to the business layer for a decision. questions.question: The project manager needs to understand the project environment and define how to manage the risk on the project. In which step of the risk management technique should this be defined?
questions.rationale: A. Correct. The ‘identify - define context and objectives’ sub-step “involves obtaining information about the project to ensure that there is a common understanding of the specific objectives that are at risk and to formulate an appropriate risk management approach. The following will have an influence on the project’s risk management approach: [...] the business’ own environment (legislative or governance requirements); business policies, standards, processes and procedures”. Ref 9.3.1.1.1 B. Incorrect. The ‘assess – prioritize risks’ step looks at “the probability that the risk will occur (often estimated by considering its likelihood or frequency); the impact of each risk in terms of the project objectives (for example, if the objectives are measured in time and cost, the impact should also be measured in units of time and cost); the impact of the risk on the stage plan, project plan, and business case”. Ref 9.3.1.2.1 C. Incorrect. The ‘plan’ step: “involves identifying and evaluating the appropriate risk response to remove or reduce threats, and to maximize opportunities”. Ref 9.3.1.3 D. Incorrect. In the ‘implement’ step: “planned risk responses need to be actioned, their effectiveness reviewed, and corrective action taken where responses do not match expectations. It is critical to ensure that the responsibilities for the risk owner and risk action owner are identified and agreed for each risk”. Ref 9.3.1.4

questions.question: What is the purpose of the ‘starting up a project’ process?

options.A: To assess whether a project is likely to be valuable to the organization
options.B: To analyse the work required before committing to implement the project initiation documentation
options.C: To provide the opportunity for the users to confirm that they accept the project product
options.D: To delegate the management of the project in a controlled way

questions.correct_answer_text: To assess whether a project is likely to be valuable to the organization
questions.rationale: A. Correct. “The purpose of the process of starting up a project is to ensure that the prerequisites for ‘initiating a project’ are established by answering the question, ‘Do we have a viable and worthwhile project?’ The decision to start the project must be explicit, as the activities within the process of starting up a project happen before this decision.” Ref 13.1 B. Incorrect. “The purpose of the process of initiating a project is to establish solid foundations for the project, enabling the business to understand the work that needs to be done to deliver the project product before committing to any significant expenditure or resources.” Ref 15.1 C. Incorrect. “The purpose of the process of closing a project is to provide a fixed point at which acceptance of the project product is confirmed. It also provides a point to recognize that the objectives or the approved changes to the objectives, as established in the project initiation documentation, have been achieved. Where there is a cause for a premature closure, this process ensures the project is closed in an orderly way.” Ref 19.1 D. Incorrect. “The purpose of the process of directing a project is to enable the project board to be accountable for the project’s success by making key decisions and exercising overall control while delegating day-to-day management of the project to the project manager.” Ref 14.1
source_files: Sample Paper 1 Answers and Rationales.pdf
Sample Paper 1.pdf

questions.question: Which process should ensure that an organization does not proceed to establish solid foundations for unsuitable projects?
questions.rationale: A. Correct. “The purpose of the process of starting up a project is as much about preventing poorly conceived ideas from ever being initiated as it is about progressing viable projects for approval. As such, ‘starting up a project’ is a lighter process compared to the more detailed and thorough process of initiating a project. The aim is to do the minimum necessary to decide whether it is worthwhile to even initiate the project.” Ref 13.1 B. Incorrect. “The purpose of the process of closing a project is to provide a fixed point at which acceptance of the project product is confirmed. It also provides a point to recognize that the objectives or the approved changes to the objectives, as established in the project initiation documentation, have been achieved. Where there is a cause for a premature close, this process ensures the project is closed in an orderly way.” Ref 19.1 C. Incorrect. “The purpose of the process of initiating a project is to establish solid foundations for the project, enabling the business to understand the work that needs to be done to deliver the project product before committing to any significant expenditure or resources.” Ref 15.1 D. Incorrect. “The purpose of the process of managing a stage boundary is to enable the project manager to provide the project board with sufficient information to be able to: review the success of the current stage; approve the next stage plan; review the updated project plan; confirm continued business justification and acceptability of the risks.” Ref 18.1 28 PRINCE2® Project Management Foundation | Sample Paper 1 Answers and Rationales | Copyright © PeopleCert International Limited Q A Syllabus Ref Rationale Q A Syllabus Ref Rationale

Project benefits may or may not be delivered in each stage. questions.question: Which describes a delivery approach that creates the products in sequence?
questions.rationale: A. Correct. “Each of the delivery steps to create the products occurs in sequence, and the product is made available during or at the end of the project (for example, in a construction project where requirements gathering and design occur before construction starts).” Ref 1.5.3 B. Incorrect. A hybrid approach is where “some elements of the project use a linear-sequential approach, and other elements use an iterative-incremental approach. For example, a linear- sequential approach can be used for the development of the infrastructure for a service. Then, an iterative-incremental approach can be used for the development of the customer service portal for users to access the service.” Ref 1.5.3 C. Incorrect. An iterative-incremental approach “is often, but not exclusively, used for product development where requirements gathering, design, development and/or coding, and testing occur iteratively throughout the lifecycle of the project. This approach is often referred to as an agile approach.” Ref 1.5.3 D. Incorrect. Event driven is not a delivery approach; it is a type of control. Event-driven controls “occur when a specific event occurs. For example, this could be the end of a stage, the completion of the PID, or the creation of an exception report. It could also include organizational events that may affect the project, such as the end of the financial year.” Ref 11.2.2

questions.question: Which principle is being applied when reviewing whether the project is still viable?
questions.rationale: A. Correct. The ‘ensure continued business justification’ principle definition states that “A PRINCE2 Project Management project has business justification sufficient to warrant investment to initiate the project and ongoing investment through to successful completion. If it does not, it should be stopped.” In addition, PRINCE2 Project Management requires “there must be a justifiable reason for starting a project and the justification must remain valid and be revalidated throughout the lifecycle of the project.” Ref 2.1 B. Incorrect. The ‘learn from experience’ principle relates to incorporating lessons through the life of the project. “A PRINCE2 Project Management project team actively seeks, records, and implements improvements as a result of relevant lessons learned from prior projects and throughout the life of the project. It applies them in future projects and shares them for others to apply.” Ref 2.2 C. Incorrect. “A PRINCE2 Project Management project focuses on the definition and delivery of products, in particular their user’s quality expectations and requirements.” Ref 2.6 D. Incorrect. The ‘tailor to suit the project’ principle is when “PRINCE2 Project Management is applied and tailored to suit the project environment, size, complexity, importance, delivery method, team capability, and level of risk.” Ref 2.7

Incorrect. Incorrect. The ‘manage by exception’ principle relates to establishing limits of delegated authority on a project. “A PRINCE2 Project Management project establishes limits of delegated authority by defining tolerances for performance against its plans.” Ref 2.5 D. questions.question: How does effective risk management enable understanding of the overall risk exposure for a project?

options.A: By positioning risks, in relation to the risk tolerance line, on a summary risk profile
options.B: By identifying different types of sustainability risks
options.C: By planning responses for each risk
options.D: By establishing a risk budget to fund management responses to risks

questions.correct_answer_text: By positioning risks, in relation to the risk tolerance line, on a summary risk profile
questions.rationale: A. Correct. “A useful way of summarizing the set of risks and their estimations is to plot them onto a risk matrix [...] This represents a situation at a specific point in time (such as a snapshot of the risk environment) [...] The risks above and to the right of the dashed risk tolerance line represent those that the business will not tolerate, except under special circumstances.” Risk exposure is defined as “the degree to which a particular objective is at risk”. Ref 9.2.2, 9.2 B. Incorrect. “The use of risk categories helps projects to identify and prioritize risks. Techniques such as PESTLE (Political, Economic, Social, Technological, Legal, and Environmental) [...] can be used to analyse the internal and external context for risks and [...] help to identify different types of risk that may affect the project.” Ref 9.2.1 C. Incorrect. “For risk management to be effective: risks that might prevent the project from achieving its objectives need to be identified, captured, and described; each risk needs to be assessed and prioritized.” After this, the overall exposure of risk needs to be understood, followed by risk response planning. Ref.9.2 D. Incorrect. A risk budget is “a sum of money to fund specific management responses to the project’s threats and opportunities (for example, to cover the costs of any contingent plans should a risk materialize)”. Ref 9.2

This includes the specific procedures, techniques, standards, and responsibilities to be applied.” Ref 9.3.1.1.1, 9.5 B. Incorrect. The ‘communicate’ step “ensures that information related to the threats and opportunities faced by the project is communicated both within the project ecosystem and externally to stakeholders from the organizational ecosystem”. Ref 9.3.1.5 C. Incorrect. “The ‘assess’ step involves prioritizing risks and assessing the combined risk profile.” Ref 9.3.1 D. Incorrect. The ‘plan’ step “involves identifying and evaluating the appropriate risk response to remove or reduce threats, and to maximize opportunities.” Ref 9.3.1.3 20 PRINCE2® Project Management Foundation | Sample Paper 2 Answers and Rationales | Copyright © PeopleCert International Limited Q A Syllabus Ref Rationale Q A Syllabus Ref Rationale

questions.question: In which process is the work undertaken to assess if project objectives have been achieved as stated in project initiation documentation have been achieved?
questions.rationale: A. Correct. “The purpose of the process of ‘closing a project’ is to provide a fixed point at which acceptance of the project product is confirmed. It also provides a point to recognize that the objectives or the approved changes to the objectives, as established in the PID, have been achieved. Where there is a cause for a premature closure, this process ensures the project is closed in an orderly way.” Ref 19.1 B. Incorrect. The purpose of the process of ‘controlling a stage’, not the ‘closing a project’ process, is to “assign work, monitor such work, handle issues, report progress to the project board, and take corrective actions to ensure that the stage remains within the tolerances set by the project board”. Ref 16.1 C. Incorrect. The purpose of the process of ‘managing product delivery’, not the ‘closing a project’ process, is to “control the link between the project manager and the team manager. This is achieved by agreeing on the requirements for acceptance, execution, reporting, and delivery of specialist products. The role of the team manager is to coordinate an area of work that will deliver one or more of the specialist products that form the project product”. Ref 17.1 D. Incorrect. The purpose of the process of ‘managing a stage boundary’, not the ‘closing a project’ process, is to “enable the project manager to provide the project board with sufficient information to be able to: review the success of the current stage; approve the next stage plan; review the updated project plan; confirm continued business justification and acceptability of risks”. Ref 18.1

questions.rationale: A. Correct. “An early identifier of potential failure is the project manager’s forecast that any of the project or stage tolerances are likely to be exceeded. In such cases, it is important to have a mechanism for corrective action to bring the project back into the right direction. […] The process of ‘managing a stage boundary’ provides a means by which an exception procedure can be implemented.” Exception plan request is a trigger for the ‘managing stage boundary’ process. Ref 18.3 B. Incorrect. In the ‘directing a project’ process, “one of the functions of the project board is to provide informal advice and guidance as well as formal direction to the project manager. This is a two-way process, with the project board updating the project manager on matters external to the project and the project manager seeking advice whenever necessary during the course of the project.” Therefore, project board advice is ongoing and can include responding to information in the highlight report, and is therefore unlikely to trigger the need for corrective action on every occasion. Ref 14.3 C. Incorrect. “For exceptions, the objectives of the process of ‘managing a stage boundary’ are similar to those listed above but include preparing an exception plan and seeking approval to replace the project or current stage plan with the exception plan.” Therefore, a request for the project board to approve an exception plan would be an output from the ‘managing a stage boundary’ process, not a trigger for corrective action. Ref 18.2 D. Incorrect. The ‘managing a stage boundary’ process will “review and, if necessary, update the PID, in particular the business case, project plan, user’s quality expectations, management approaches, project management team structure, and role descriptions”. However, “an early identifier of potential failure is the project manager’s forecast that any of the project or stage tolerances are likely to be exceeded”, not a request for change to the project team. Ref 18.2, 18.3

questions.rationale: A. Correct. “Normally the process of ‘controlling a stage’ is used first after the project board authorizes the project, but it can be used during the initiation stage, especially for large or complex projects.” Ref 16.3 B. Incorrect. “If the project manager is fulfilling the team manager role, work package descriptions should still be used to define and control the work of the individual team members.” ‘The controlling a stage’ process is still relevant to each stage even if the project manager fulfils the role of team manager. Ref 16.3 C. Incorrect. “The activities within the process of managing a stage boundary will occur towards the end of each stage [...] with the exception of the final stage.” The ‘controlling a stage’ process and the ‘managing a stage’ boundary process are not merged. Ref 16.3 D. Incorrect. “Team managers can be internal or external to the organization running the project.” They do not have to be only internal. The ‘controlling a stage’ process should still be used when team managers are internal. questions.question: Which of the following best describes a key characteristic that distinguishes project work from business-as-usual operations?

options.A: Projects are managed by functional teams using repeatable processes
options.B: Projects are designed to maintain operational stability across business units
options.C: Projects are temporary in nature and created to deliver change
options.D: Projects follow the same structure as daily routine activities within departments

questions.correct_answer_text: Projects are temporary in nature and created to deliver change
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 defines a project as a temporary organisation created for the purpose of delivering one or more business products according to an agreed business case. The key characteristics include change, temporariness, cross-functionality, uniqueness, and uncertainty—all of which distinguish projects from business-as-usual (BAU) activities. Topic 1.3: What is a Project?
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of applying project management to a PRINCE2 project?

options.A: To ensure specialist development activities are completed correctly
options.B: To reduce ambiguity and control the work needed to achieve project objectives
options.C: To monitor individual performance of project team members
options.D: To prescribe the specific tools and templates to be used for delivery

questions.correct_answer_text: To reduce ambiguity and control the work needed to achieve project objectives
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 defines project management as "the application of methods, tools, techniques, and competencies to enable the project to meet its objectives." The key purpose of project management is to reduce and manage ambiguity by clarifying objectives, planning, delegating, monitoring, and controlling all aspects of the project—ensuring that the team is aligned and motivated toward performance targets. Topic 1.4: What is project management?
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: A project team is reviewing which organisational factors might influence how they manage a new clinical trial project. These include regulatory frameworks, industry sector practices, and company maturity. Which PRINCE2 concept best describes this type of consideration?
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 defines the project context as encompassing all internal and external factors that affect how a project is started, delivered, assured, and closed. This includes organisational standards, industry sector specifics, geographical locations, regulatory frameworks, and the maturity level of the organisation. Topic 1.5: The Project Context 1
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following is a key benefit of adopting PRINCE2 Project Management as a standard method within an organisation?

options.A: It mandates the use of agile practices across all projects
options.B: It eliminates the need for role definitions in project teams
options.C: It supports increased organisational maturity through continual improvement
options.D: It replaces the need for industry-specific models in complex environments

questions.correct_answer_text: It supports increased organisational maturity through continual improvement
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 Project Management offers several benefits, including improved organisational capability and maturity. One of the key advantages is that it promotes learning from experience and continual improvement, thereby helping organisations enhance their overall project delivery maturity. It is designed to be flexible, universal, and integrable with other methods, not a replacement for them. Topic 1.6: Features and benefits of PRINCE2 Project Management
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the importance of business justification in a PRINCE2 project?

options.A: It is used to evaluate team performance across different project stages
options.B: It ensures the project remains aligned with business objectives and is worth continued investment
options.C: It defines how lessons learned should be recorded and shared
options.D: It determines the sequence in which project products are delivered

questions.correct_answer_text: It ensures the project remains aligned with business objectives and is worth
questions.rationale: Business justification is a core principle in PRINCE2. A project must have a justifiable reason for starting and continuing, and that justification must remain valid throughout the lifecycle. If the justification is no longer valid, the project should be stopped to prevent waste of resources and allow reinvestment elsewhere Topic 2.1: Ensure Continued Business Justification
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: A government-funded project is halfway through its lifecycle. New legislation makes the original deliverables less relevant. What is the correct PRINCE2 action based on the principle of continued business justification?

options.A: Pause the project and wait for political clarification
options.B: Continue the project as planned to avoid loss of sunk costs
options.C: Reassess the business case and close the project if it is no longer justified
options.D: Deliver the project faster to avoid negative stakeholder feedback

questions.correct_answer_text: Reassess the business case and close the project if it is no longer justified
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 encourages active monitoring of business justification throughout the project lifecycle. If circumstances change such that the justification no longer holds, continuing the project is 2
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the key difference between a ‘lesson identified’ and a ‘lesson learned’ in PRINCE2?

options.A: Lessons identified refer to failed projects, while lessons learned refer to successful ones
options.B: Lessons identified are suggestions, while lessons learned are agreed improvements implemented
options.C: Lessons identified are documented only at project closure, while lessons learned are shared earlier
options.D: Lessons identified focus on supplier issues, while lessons learned are for internal review

questions.correct_answer_text: Lessons identified are suggestions, while lessons learned are agreed
questions.rationale: A lesson is only considered “learned” if it leads to action—improvement or application in current or future projects. If no action is taken, it's merely a “lesson identified”. Topic 2.2: Learn from Experience
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: A project team has completed Stage 1. In preparation for Stage 2, they review lessons from previous projects and update their work practices. What principle are they demonstrating?
questions.rationale: Learning should occur at the start, during, and after the project, with lessons influencing project delivery. PRINCE2 emphasises learning from past and current experiences. Topic 2.2: Learn from Experience
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a core reason for explicitly defining roles and responsibilities in a PRINCE2 project?

options.A: To allow team members to shift roles frequently
options.B: To focus only on high-level deliverables
options.C: To enable stakeholder engagement and ensure clear accountability
options.D: To reduce the number of communication channels

questions.correct_answer_text: To enable stakeholder engagement and ensure clear accountability
questions.rationale: Clearly defining roles helps ensure all stakeholder interests are represented and establishes unambiguous accountability within the project structure. Topic 2.3: Define Roles, Responsibilities and Relationships 3
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: A project involves multiple suppliers and departments, each with its own management structures. What PRINCE2 principle helps ensure effective collaboration?
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 mandates a clearly defined and agreed project management team structure that considers diverse stakeholder relationships and responsibilities. Topic 2.3: Define Roles, Responsibilities and Relationships
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is a key benefit of managing a PRINCE2 project by stages?

options.A: It reduces the need for formal documentation
options.B: It enables continual review of viability and control at defined points
options.C: It avoids the need for senior management involvement
options.D: It ensures the team can deliver without governance constraints

questions.correct_answer_text: It enables continual review of viability and control at defined points
questions.rationale: Managing by stages allows for stage-by-stage authorisation and decision-making, improving adaptability and control. Topic 2.4: Manage by Stages
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: A project team completes work in two-week sprints. At the end of each sprint, they assess progress and confirm continuation. What principle is being demonstrated?
questions.rationale: Even in agile environments, PRINCE2's manage by stages principle applies when control points like sprint reviews help assess viability and guide progression. Topic 2.4: Manage by Stages
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following best defines “tolerance” in the context of managing by exception?

options.A: The maximum acceptable risk level for each work package
options.B: A measurement of quality used during product acceptance
options.C: The permissible deviation in plan targets before escalation is needed
options.D: The preferred approach to tailoring documentation 4 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd

questions.correct_answer_text: The permissible deviation in plan targets before escalation is needed
questions.rationale: Tolerance defines the allowed deviation in aspects like cost, time, or scope before it is considered an exception and needs escalation. Topic 2.5: Manage by Exception
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which situation best illustrates the application of the “manage by exception” principle?

options.A: The team independently re-prioritises deliverables without consulting the project board
options.B: The project manager delegates procurement decisions to the supplier
options.C: A cost overrun is predicted, so the issue is escalated because it exceeds the agreed tolerance
options.D: The business change manager insists on attending all work package reviews

questions.correct_answer_text: A cost overrun is predicted, so the issue is escalated because it exceeds the
questions.rationale: Manage by exception means escalation only occurs when tolerances are forecast to be exceeded; otherwise, authority is delegated to the lower level. Topic 2.5: Manage by Exception
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Why does PRINCE2 recommend focusing on products instead of work activities?

options.A: To reduce the number of team meetings
options.B: To ensure that only agreed outputs are produced and scope creep is managed
options.D: To avoid having to estimate resources or plan activities

questions.correct_answer_text: To ensure that only agreed outputs are produced and scope creep is managed
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 focuses on outputs (products) to avoid unnecessary work, manage change, and meet user expectations more effectively. Topic 2.6: Focus on Products
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which statement reflects the principle of “focus on products”?

options.A: The project is guided by user needs, which are clarified after implementation
options.B: All tasks are scheduled first, and deliverables are defined afterward
options.C: Product descriptions are created before work begins to define scope and quality expectations
options.D: Project planning occurs at the team level only

questions.correct_answer_text: Product descriptions are created before work begins to define scope and quality
questions.rationale: By defining product descriptions early, PRINCE2 ensures alignment between expectations and delivery, enabling clear scope and planning. Topic 2.6: Focus on Products
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: How does the principle “tailor to suit the project” help organisations using PRINCE2? 5

options.A: It allows projects to bypass core processes if the team is experienced
options.B: It ensures PRINCE2 is applied rigidly for audit compliance
options.C: It enables the method to be scaled to fit project size, complexity, and risk
options.D: It restricts innovation by enforcing standard forms and templates

questions.correct_answer_text: It enables the method to be scaled to fit project size, complexity, and risk
questions.rationale: Tailoring ensures PRINCE2 remains relevant and effective regardless of industry or context by adapting formality and control levels to project needs. Topic 2.7: Tailor to Suit the Project
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following is an acceptable example of tailoring PRINCE2?

options.A: Removing all project documentation to streamline delivery
options.B: Replacing the stage boundary process with an unstructured review
options.C: Adjusting the detail of the quality register based on project complexity
options.D: Using another methodology’s principles instead of PRINCE2’s

questions.correct_answer_text: Adjusting the detail of the quality register based on project complexity
questions.rationale: Tailoring in PRINCE2 refers to modifying the level of control, formality, and documentation to suit the project environment while retaining adherence to core principles. Topic 2.7: Tailor to Suit the Project
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following best defines the relationship between the project ecosystem and the organisational ecosystem?

options.A: The organisational ecosystem only includes the project team and their direct managers
options.B: The project ecosystem is part of the organisational ecosystem and includes people directly involved in or impacted by the project
options.C: The organisational ecosystem is shaped by the project ecosystem during delivery
options.D: The project ecosystem consists solely of suppliers and delivery partners

questions.correct_answer_text: The project ecosystem is part of the organisational ecosystem and includes
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 defines the project ecosystem as those elements of the business involved in or directly impacted by the project, while the organisational ecosystem includes broader internal and external stakeholders such as customers, regulators, and partners. The project operates within the larger organisational context. Topic 3.1: Context
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Identify the missing word: In PRINCE2, the [ ? ] determines how project decisions are escalated based on levels of knowledge and impact.

options.D: communication matrix 6 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd

questions.rationale: A layered governance structure, often underpinned by the principle of manage by exception, ensures that decisions are made at the level where the relevant knowledge resides and are escalated only when broader implications are involved. Topic 3.1: Context
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which statement best describes the role of leadership in PRINCE2 project management?

options.A: Applying formal authority to drive decisions and performance
options.B: Delivering results through efficient use of technical resources
options.C: Motivating, influencing, and co-creating with people across the project ecosystem
options.D: Delegating responsibilities using job titles and hierarchy

questions.correct_answer_text: Motivating, influencing, and co-creating with people across the project
questions.rationale: Leadership in PRINCE2 involves persuasion, influence, and co-creation across the project ecosystem, often without relying on formal authority. It aims to align people and maintain focus on objectives. Topic 3.2: Leadership
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: A project manager is finding it difficult to gain support from team members who report to other departments. What leadership approach would best help in this situation?

options.B: Rely on formal reporting lines to manage tasks
options.C: Build relationships and align interests to foster informal influence
options.D: Reduce the project scope to avoid dependency on other teams

questions.correct_answer_text: Build relationships and align interests to foster informal influence
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 recognises that many project team members have multiple reporting lines. Effective leadership requires relational skills and informal influence to gain cooperation in such settings. Topic 3.2: Leadership
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the change management approach in PRINCE2?

options.A: To approve changes in supplier contracts
options.B: To define roles for monitoring technical baselines
options.C: To describe how the business will move from the current to the target state
options.D: To replace the communication management approach

questions.correct_answer_text: To describe how the business will move from the current to the target state
questions.rationale: The change management approach in PRINCE2 supports the transition between current, interim, and target organisational states by defining enabling activities such as training and communication. Topic 3.3: Change Management 7
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following are considered enabling activities in a PRINCE2 change management approach? 1. Upskilling and training staff 2. Updating the project initiation document 3. Modelling future workflows 4. Generating a new benefits management approach
questions.rationale: Enabling activities like training, consultation, and modelling help the organisation shift to the new state. These are key inclusions in a well-scoped change management approach. Topic 3.3: Change Management
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the purpose of the communication management approach?

options.A: To ensure senior managers are updated weekly
options.B: To define how and when information flows within the project ecosystem
options.C: To control messaging through pre-approved communication scripts
options.D: To publish project reports in a central repository

questions.correct_answer_text: To define how and when information flows within the project ecosystem
questions.rationale: The communication management approach ensures bi-directional and tailored communication across the ecosystem. It supports alignment, engagement, and feedback management. Topic 3.4: Communication and Engagement
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Identify the missing word: Generic messaging is rarely effective in PRINCE2. Successful engagement depends on understanding stakeholder concerns and working with [ ? ] to tailor the message.
questions.rationale: Engagement is most effective when key influencers from user, supplier, and business groups help shape and disseminate messaging that aligns with stakeholder needs. Topic 3.4: Communication and Engagement 8
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Why is it important to consider people factors in organisational change within PRINCE2?

options.A: Because projects are mandated by external policies
options.B: Because change is always externally driven
options.C: Because human dynamics influence acceptance and adoption of change
options.D: Because standard project processes ignore people issues

questions.correct_answer_text: Because human dynamics influence acceptance and adoption of change
questions.rationale: People are central to successful organisational change. Relationships, perception, culture, and engagement must be actively managed to ensure project products are adopted and benefits realised. Topic 3.5: Organisational Change Management
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following best illustrates the role of communication in organisational change?

options.A: Broadcasting decisions made by the board
options.B: Providing feedback channels and monitoring relational health
options.C: Delegating messaging to external PR firms
options.D: Issuing monthly newsletters as a compliance requirement

questions.correct_answer_text: Providing feedback channels and monitoring relational health
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 emphasises listening and feedback loops as vital components of communication, especially in managing organisational change. It goes beyond formal messaging to maintain engagement and address resistance. Topic 3.5: Organisational Change Management
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the main reason PRINCE2 Project Management requires its seven practices to be applied continually and in parallel?

options.A: Because the practices replace traditional delivery lifecycles
options.B: To ensure that each stakeholder group has a dedicated document
options.C: To maintain effective control of critical aspects across the project lifecycle
options.D: Because each practice is only relevant during project initiation

questions.correct_answer_text: To maintain effective control of critical aspects across the project lifecycle
questions.rationale: The seven practices must be applied consistently and throughout the project. This ensures that the project management team can continually manage risk, ensure alignment with business objectives, and provide structure across all stages of the project lifecycle. Topic 4.1: The PRINCE2 Project Management Practices
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Identify the missing word: The strength of PRINCE2 lies in how the seven practices are [ ? ] and used across all project processes. 9
questions.rationale: The practices are not standalone; their value comes from how they are integrated and applied together across all project processes, ensuring holistic governance and control. Topic 4.1: The PRINCE2 Project Management Practices
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following best explains the relationship between outputs, outcomes, and benefits in PRINCE2?

options.A: Outputs result directly in benefits without requiring change
options.B: Benefits are the capabilities delivered by the project
options.C: Outcomes arise from changes enabled by outputs and lead to measurable benefits
options.D: Outputs are business objectives used to measure project success

questions.correct_answer_text: Outcomes arise from changes enabled by outputs and lead to measurable
questions.rationale: In PRINCE2, projects deliver outputs (specialist products), which enable capabilities, leading to outcomes. These outcomes then result in benefits, which are measurable improvements aligned to business objectives. Topic 5.1: Business Case
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: A project is using an iterative approach. The business case includes must-have, should-have, and could-have requirements. Which statement best reflects how benefits should be framed?

options.A: Benefits should only be estimated based on the best-case scenario
options.B: The business case should only include must-have requirements to reduce risk
options.C: Benefits should be framed using worst-case, expected-case, and best-case scenarios
options.D: Benefits should be excluded until delivery is complete

questions.correct_answer_text: Benefits should be framed using worst-case, expected-case, and best-case
questions.rationale: In iterative-incremental delivery approaches, benefits are often framed as a range—worst- case (must-haves only), expected-case (must-haves and should-haves), and best-case (including could-haves)—to reflect variability in scope delivery. Topic 5.1: Business Case
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following best summarises the purpose of the Business Case practice in PRINCE2?

options.A: To document assumptions used in the risk and sustainability registers
options.B: To validate that the project approach conforms to regulatory standards
options.C: To determine whether the project remains desirable, viable, and achievable
options.D: To summarise the expected effort and costs of the delivery team 10 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd

questions.correct_answer_text: To determine whether the project remains desirable, viable, and achievable
questions.rationale: The purpose of the business case practice is to provide the mechanism to judge whether a project is and continues to be desirable (balance of costs, risks, and benefits), viable (can deliver the products), and achievable (benefits are likely to be realised from outcomes). Topic 5.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Identify the missing word: All projects must have a business justification, usually documented in a business case. Business justification is not only about costs but also about the [ ? ] a project can deliver relative to the resources used.
questions.rationale: Business justification refers to the overall value of the project: whether the expected outcomes and benefits justify the investment of time, cost, and risk. PRINCE2 evaluates this through the business case throughout the project lifecycle. Topic 5.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: At which point in the project lifecycle is the outline business case typically created?

options.A: During the process of initiating a project
options.B: After the project board has approved the exception plan
options.C: In response to the project brief at the end of stage 1
options.D: At project start-up based on the project mandate

questions.correct_answer_text: At project start-up based on the project mandate
questions.rationale: The outline business case is first developed during project start-up, based on the initial input from the project mandate. It is documented in the project brief and is refined later into a full business case during project initiation. Topic 5.2: Guidance for Effective Business Case Management
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which statement about benefits and outcomes in PRINCE2 is CORRECT?

options.A: Benefits and outcomes are always realised during project execution
options.B: Forecast benefits must be escalated if they fall outside of agreed tolerances
options.C: Benefits can be reported without measurement if their value is self-evident
options.D: Benefits management is limited to internal business stakeholders

questions.correct_answer_text: Forecast benefits must be escalated if they fall outside of agreed tolerances
questions.rationale: The guidance states that benefits should be forecast, tracked, and measured. If expected benefits fall outside of set tolerance levels, the situation must be escalated for review and potential corrective action. Topic 5.2: Guidance for Effective Business Case Management 11
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the four steps in PRINCE2’s business case management technique?
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 uses a four-step business case technique: Develop, Check, Maintain, and Confirm. “Execute” is not one of these steps. Topic 5.3: Techniques
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which investment appraisal technique considers the time value of money using discounted future cash flows?
questions.rationale: NPV reflects the value of future cash flows adjusted for the time value of money. It’s one of several techniques PRINCE2 recognises for investment appraisal in business case evaluation. Topic 5.3: Techniques
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following items is typically included in the outline business case within the project brief?

options.B: Description of the selected business option

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Identify the missing word: The [ ? ] describes how the project’s performance will be reviewed against sustainability goals and includes baselines and measurement criteria. 12

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which type of tolerance is used to manage deviation in the project’s expected social or environmental outcomes?
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 defines sustainability tolerance as the permissible deviation in sustainability performance targets before escalation is required. Topic 5.5: Information Needs
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following must be included when valuing a business case investment? 1. Operational costs post-project 2. Programme-level assumptions 3. Dis-benefits 4. Stakeholder feedback on branding
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 requires business cases to account for both the ongoing operational costs and dis- benefits—the measurable negative consequences of the project. Topic 5.5: Information Needs
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which role is accountable for ensuring the project remains desirable, viable, and achievable throughout its lifecycle?

questions.rationale: The project executive owns the business case and is responsible for ensuring the ongoing justification for investment across the project lifecycle. Topic 5.6: Responsibilities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Who is accountable for specifying the desired outcomes and ensuring the project delivers benefits?

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which statement best reflects how PRINCE2 recommends tailoring the business case?

options.A: Business cases must follow a fixed format regardless of project size

options.C: The detail and format of the business case should reflect the scale and complexity of the project

questions.correct_answer_text: The detail and format of the business case should reflect the scale and
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 encourages tailoring. For small projects, the project brief and business case might be merged. Larger projects may require detailed formats like full environmental impact studies. Topic 5.7: Application Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: In an iterative-incremental delivery project, how should the business case typically evolve?

options.A: Remain fixed after approval to avoid confusion
options.B: Only include ‘must have’ features to limit scope

options.D: Be simplified into a single-page summary for decision-makers

questions.correct_answer_text: Be reviewed frequently and updated based on delivery insights

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the organizing practice in PRINCE2?

questions.rationale: The plans practice defines what is to be delivered, by whom, how, when, where, and for how much—to ensure communication, understanding, and control of project performance. Topic 7.1: Purpose

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the risk practice in PRINCE2?
