questions.rationale: PRINCE2 categorises risks into negative (threats) and positive (opportunities)—both of which can affect the delivery of time, cost, quality, and sustainability targets. Topic 9.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO elements are essential to effective risk management in PRINCE2? 1. Identifying and prioritising risks 2. Estimating final costs and benefits 3. Assigning ownership for responses 4. Comparing project and programme registers
questions.rationale: Effective risk management involves identifying, prioritising, and responding to risks—and assigning ownership to appropriate individuals. Topic 9.2: Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What does PRINCE2 define as the person responsible for managing, monitoring, and controlling all aspects of a specific risk?
questions.rationale: The risk owner is accountable for the end-to-end handling of a particular risk, including control, escalation, and resolution. Topic 9.2: Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT part of PRINCE2’s five-step risk management technique?

options.D: Communicate 27 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd

questions.rationale: The five steps are: Identify, Assess, Plan, Implement, and Communicate. “Respond” is not a named step but falls under “Plan” and “Implement”. Topic 9.3: Techniques
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which technique helps identify the root causes of a risk in order to reduce its probability or impact?
questions.rationale: Also called an Ishikawa diagram, it helps teams identify multiple risk drivers to inform targeted risk responses. Topic 9.3: Techniques
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the purpose of the risk management approach in PRINCE2?

options.A: To detail how the project will deliver the product breakdown structure
options.B: To define how risk will be managed throughout the project
options.C: To ensure the business case is aligned with stakeholder needs
options.D: To log changes to product descriptions

questions.correct_answer_text: To define how risk will be managed throughout the project
questions.rationale: The risk management approach documents procedures, tools, standards, and responsibilities for managing risks in the project lifecycle. Topic 9.4: Management Products
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which document records identified threats and opportunities, along with status and ownership?
questions.rationale: The risk register is a live record of all identified risks, their analysis, responses, and status throughout the project. Topic 9.4: Management Products
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following are standard attributes recorded for a risk? 1. Probability 2. Proximity 3. Sustainability rating 28
questions.rationale: Probability (likelihood) and velocity (speed of impact) are two of the standard attributes tracked in PRINCE2 risk profiles. Topic 9.5: Information Needs
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which statement best describes “risk appetite” in PRINCE2?

options.A: A technique to model potential impacts
options.B: A funding buffer for managing high-risk activities
options.C: A qualitative scoring matrix for risk velocity
options.D: The level and type of risk the business is willing to accept

questions.correct_answer_text: The level and type of risk the business is willing to accept
questions.rationale: Risk appetite reflects the business’s tolerance for taking on risk in pursuit of its objectives, as defined in the business case and applied by the project board. Topic 9.5: Information Needs
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which role is responsible for maintaining the risk register and ensuring it is kept up to date?
questions.rationale: Project support maintains the risk register and provides administrative assistance with updates and version control Topic 9.6: Responsibilities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Who is accountable for ensuring risks are escalated if they threaten business justification?
questions.rationale: The project executive owns the business case and ensures that risks are managed in a way that protects the business justification, including escalation where needed. Topic 9.6: Responsibilities 29
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following is an acceptable tailoring approach for small, low-risk projects?

options.A: Omitting risk responses to streamline delivery
options.B: Documenting risks on a shared whiteboard or spreadsheet
options.C: Escalating all risks to a steering committee
options.D: Ignoring risk opportunities and focusing only on threats

questions.correct_answer_text: Documenting risks on a shared whiteboard or spreadsheet
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 supports proportionality; small projects may use simple tools like whiteboards or spreadsheets for risk management as long as responsibilities and ownership are maintained. Topic 9.7: Application Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which principle is reinforced when tailoring risk responses to align with the risk tolerance set by the business?
questions.rationale: Managing by exception is applied through risk tolerances, where only deviations that exceed set limits are escalated, allowing efficient governance and focus Topic 9.7: Application Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the issues practice in PRINCE2?

options.A: To ensure quality activities are completed in all work packages
options.B: To control changes to the project’s baseline and manage emerging issues
options.C: To assign budgets for specialist product development

questions.correct_answer_text: To control changes to the project’s baseline and manage emerging issues
questions.rationale: The issues practice is designed to collect and assess issues and handle changes in a responsive but controlled way, ensuring the integrity of the project baseline. Topic 10.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Identify the missing word: In PRINCE2, a change is defined as a modification to any of the approved [ ? ] that constitute the project baseline.

options.B: processes 30 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd

questions.rationale: A change affects approved specialist or management products that make up the project baseline and must go through change control. Topic 10.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of PRINCE2's issue management approach?
questions.rationale: The five components of issue management include baselines, issue resolution, change control, delegated authority, and change budget—not stakeholder prioritisation. Topic 10.2: Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following are types of issues identified by PRINCE2? 1. Off-specification 2. Risk opportunity 3. Request for change 4. Schedule buffer
questions.rationale: Issues are categorised as off-specifications, requests for change, problems/concerns, external events, or business opportunities—not risk opportunities or buffers. Topic 10.2: Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following best describes PRINCE2’s approach to issue resolution?

options.A: All issues must be resolved at project board level
options.B: The project manager assesses issues and decides resolution paths based on tolerances and delegated authority
options.C: All issues must be included in the issue register but not necessarily resolved
options.D: Issues should be handled by team managers unless they affect quality

questions.correct_answer_text: The project manager assesses issues and decides resolution paths based on
questions.rationale: The project manager uses the issue and change control procedure to manage issues within delegated limits. Issues exceeding tolerances are escalated. Topic 10.3: Techniques
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following actions is typically associated with resolving a request for change?

options.A: Updating the issue log with additional quality criteria
options.B: Assessing impact on scope, cost, time, risk, and benefits

questions.correct_answer_text: Assessing impact on scope, cost, time, risk, and benefits
questions.rationale: A change request requires full impact analysis across the project parameters before approval or rejection can be recommended. Topic 10.3: Techniques
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which product records all identified issues and proposed changes?
questions.rationale: The issue register captures the description, category, impact, status, and actions related to all issues, including changes and off-specifications. Topic 10.4: Management Products
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: The change control approach defines:

options.A: How and when change requests will be handled, including escalation routes
options.B: How stakeholder reviews will be scheduled
options.C: The budget breakdown for business benefits
options.D: Which quality criteria should be applied to specialist products

questions.correct_answer_text: How and when change requests will be handled, including escalation routes
questions.rationale: The change control approach sets out procedures, roles, and budget provisions for identifying, evaluating, and approving or rejecting changes. Topic 10.4: Management Products
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following are typical contents of the issue register? 1. Status of each issue 2. Project benefits 3. Assigned owner 4. Risk responses 32
questions.rationale: The issue register includes a description, status, and owner for each issue. It does not track project benefits or risk responses (those are handled elsewhere). Topic 10.5: Information Needs
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the purpose of a change budget?

options.A: To track the cost of contract penalties
options.B: To compensate suppliers for project delays
options.C: To fund the implementation of approved changes

questions.correct_answer_text: To fund the implementation of approved changes
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 recommends setting aside a change budget to cover the cost of approved changes without needing to amend project tolerances. Topic 10.5: Information Needs
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Who is accountable for deciding whether to approve, reject, or defer a request for change?
questions.rationale: The change authority is appointed by the project board to make decisions on changes within their delegated limits. Topic 10.6: Responsibilities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which role is responsible for maintaining the issue register?
questions.rationale: Project support typically maintains logs such as the issue register, ensuring records are accurate and up to date. Topic 10.6: Responsibilities 33
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which tailoring approach to issue management is consistent with PRINCE2 guidance?

options.A: Using an email inbox to track issues on small internal projects
options.B: Allowing each team to define its own issue escalation rules
options.C: Escalating all issues to the project board regardless of severity
options.D: Skipping issue documentation for routine concerns

questions.correct_answer_text: Using an email inbox to track issues on small internal projects
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 allows flexible, proportionate issue tracking tools as long as the procedure is clear, accountable, and agreed upon. Topic 10.7: Application Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which principle is best demonstrated by applying a structured issue management process and escalating only when tolerances are exceeded?
questions.rationale: Structured issue resolution supports decision-making at the right level and enables escalation only when thresholds (tolerances) are breached. Topic 10.7: Application Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the progress practice in PRINCE2?

options.A: To create quality criteria for completed products
options.B: To assign roles to manage project costs and risk
options.C: To monitor and forecast project performance and control deviations
options.D: To ensure users receive accurate benefits

questions.correct_answer_text: To monitor and forecast project performance and control deviations
questions.rationale: The progress practice exists to compare achievements against plans, forecast future viability, and manage exceptions based on performance targets such as benefits, cost, time, and risk. Topic 11.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Identify the missing word: An [ ? ] is a forecast deviation that will exceed agreed tolerances and must be escalated.

options.D: escalation 34 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd

questions.rationale: An exception is triggered when tolerances will likely be exceeded and the current level of authority must escalate the decision. Topic 11.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the purpose of applying the plan-do-check-act cycle in progress management?

options.A: To define a fixed delivery sequence
options.C: To enable continuous improvement in decision-making and control

questions.correct_answer_text: To enable continuous improvement in decision-making and control
questions.rationale: The Deming cycle (plan-do-check-act) supports adaptive control and regular progress reviews, making room for improvements throughout the lifecycle. Topic 11.2: Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following are used as progress controls in PRINCE2? 1. Time-driven controls 2. Risk thresholds 3. Event-driven controls 4. Budget deviation levels
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 progress control uses both time-driven (e.g., regular reporting) and event-driven (e.g., stage end, exception) controls. Topic 11.2: Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following techniques does PRINCE2 recommend for managing progress?
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 relies on baselining plans and setting tolerances as a core technique for controlling project progress and identifying when escalation is needed. Topic 11.3: Techniques 35
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following help define tolerances in PRINCE2? 1. Time 2. Capability 3. Cost 4. Geography
questions.rationale: Tolerances in PRINCE2 can be set for time, cost, quality, scope, risk, and benefits—not geography or capability directly. Topic 11.3: Techniques
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which management product provides a time-driven summary of stage performance to the project board?
questions.rationale: The highlight report is typically submitted at agreed intervals to inform the project board of performance, issues, and forecasts for the current stage. Topic 11.4: Management Products
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: The project log can be used to record:

options.C: Observations, early warnings, and informal risks or issues

questions.correct_answer_text: Observations, early warnings, and informal risks or issues
questions.rationale: The project log serves as a low-formality tool to record early insights, informal issues, and context that may evolve into register entries later. Topic 11.4: Management Products
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which information need is directly supported by stage-level baselines?

options.B: Team role allocation 36 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd

questions.rationale: Stage-level baselines provide the framework against which progress is monitored and forecast, allowing intervention when deviation threatens delivery. Topic 11.5: Information Needs
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO sources of information are most commonly used for routine progress tracking? 1. Highlight reports 2. Exception reports 3. Project logs 4. Risk budgets
questions.rationale: Routine progress tracking relies on highlight reports for formal updates and project logs for informal, early-stage data. Topic 11.5: Information Needs
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Who is responsible for approving exception plans?
questions.rationale: The project board evaluates and approves exception plans when tolerances are forecast to be exceeded, as part of its oversight role. Topic 11.6: Responsibilities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which role is responsible for preparing highlight reports?
questions.rationale: The project manager consolidates status information into highlight reports for the project board to assess overall progress and emerging risks. Topic 11.6: Responsibilities 37
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is a valid tailoring decision for managing progress in a low-risk project?

options.A: Replacing progress baselines with weekly team huddles
options.B: Reducing reporting frequency and simplifying highlight reports
options.D: Eliminating tolerances to enable full flexibility

questions.correct_answer_text: Reducing reporting frequency and simplifying highlight reports
questions.rationale: In small or low-risk projects, PRINCE2 allows simplified and proportionate progress control—while retaining core structure like plans and tolerances. Topic 11.7: Application Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which principle is directly supported by escalating deviations only when tolerances are forecast to be breached?
questions.rationale: Escalation based on tolerances ensures decisions are made at the appropriate level only when required—reflecting PRINCE2’s manage by exception principle. Topic 11.7: Application Guidance
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the 'Starting up a project' process?

options.A: To assign work packages to delivery teams
options.B: To approve the final business case
options.C: To establish whether the project is viable and worthwhile
options.D: To create the detailed delivery plan

questions.correct_answer_text: To establish whether the project is viable and worthwhile
questions.rationale: This process determines if the prerequisites for initiating a project are in place and avoids investing in poorly conceived ideas. Topic 13.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which statement best describes the 'lighter' nature of the 'Starting up a project' process?

options.A: It avoids appointing any team members
options.B: It uses fewer governance controls to speed up delivery
options.C: It performs only the minimum necessary to decide whether to initiate
options.D: It replaces the need for a business case 38 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd

questions.correct_answer_text: It performs only the minimum necessary to decide whether to initiate
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 explicitly positions this process as “lighter” than initiation to avoid wasting time and effort on projects that aren’t viable. Topic 13.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following are objectives of the 'Starting up a project' process? 1. To create a detailed benefits management approach 2. To develop a project brief 3. To define the communication plan for the project 4. To ensure a business justification exists
questions.rationale: The process ensures a business justification is documented in the outline business case, and sufficient information is gathered in the form of a project brief. Topic 13.2: Objectives
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following would result from skipping the 'Starting up a project' process?

options.C: Proceeding without sufficient justification or scope clarity

questions.correct_answer_text: Proceeding without sufficient justification or scope clarity
questions.rationale: Without this process, the project may be initiated based on unsound assumptions, leading to rework and waste. Topic 13.2: Objectives
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Why does PRINCE2 recommend separating the 'Starting up a project' and 'Initiating a project' processes?

options.A: To allow delivery work to begin while documents are being written
options.B: To reduce the need for stakeholder involvement early on
options.C: To ensure that only viable and justified projects proceed to initiation
options.D: To delay team formation until product delivery begins

questions.correct_answer_text: To ensure that only viable and justified projects proceed to initiation
questions.rationale: This separation helps organisations avoid wasting resources by investing in only those projects that are properly scoped and justified. Topic 13.3: Context 39
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following best describes when the 'Starting up a project' process begins?

options.A: Immediately after the benefits management approach is baselined
options.B: Once a project board has approved the stage plan
options.C: When a project mandate is issued to trigger the evaluation of a potential project
options.D: When the team plan is complete

questions.correct_answer_text: When a project mandate is issued to trigger the evaluation of a potential project
questions.rationale: The project mandate, issued by corporate or programme management, formally triggers the 'Starting up a project' process. Topic 13.3: Context
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which activity in the 'Starting up a project' process is responsible for defining the structure of accountability?

options.B: Design and appoint the project management team

questions.correct_answer_text: Design and appoint the project management team
questions.rationale: This activity confirms the governance structure and roles to ensure clear accountability before project initiation. Topic 13.4: Activities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following are performed in the 'Starting up a project' process? 1. Develop the project plan 2. Create the project brief 3. Appoint the project manager and executive 4. Approve the project product description
questions.rationale: Creating the project brief and confirming key roles are key preparatory steps in the 'Starting up a project' process. The project plan and product descriptions are developed later during initiation. Topic 13.4: Activities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: How should the 'Starting up a project' process be tailored for a repeatable, low-risk internal project?

options.B: Combine project brief and initiation documentation into one artefact 40 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd
options.C: Skip the appointment of the project executive
options.D: Delay governance setup until after the delivery team is hired

questions.correct_answer_text: Combine project brief and initiation documentation into one artefact
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 supports proportional tailoring. In simple environments, the documentation and steps may be consolidated while retaining essential content and decision points. Topic 13.5: Applying the Process
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which principle is most reinforced by applying the 'Starting up a project' process?
questions.rationale: By clarifying the business case and the viability of the project before investing further, this process enforces the principle of sustained justification. Topic 13.5: Applying the Process
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Who is accountable for authorising the initiation of the project?
questions.rationale: The project board reviews the project brief and outline business case, then decides whether to proceed to project initiation. Topic 13.6: Responsibilities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Who is responsible for creating the project brief?
questions.rationale: The project manager prepares the project brief and other planning inputs under the guidance of the executive and in consultation with stakeholders. Topic 13.6: Responsibilities 41
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which practice is applied during 'Starting up a project' to ensure early understanding of stakeholder interests?
questions.rationale: People practices are applied early to understand the project ecosystem and engage key individuals, even before delivery begins. Topic 13.7: Application of Practices
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO practices are most important during 'Starting up a project' for defining project justification and structure? 1. Business Case 2. Issues 3. Organizing 4. Progress
questions.rationale: Business Case and Organizing are foundational in this process—defining why the project exists and who is accountable for what from the outset. Topic 13.7: Application of Practices
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the 'Directing a Project' process in PRINCE2?

options.A: To manage day-to-day activities of the project
options.B: To ensure user acceptance of project deliverables
options.C: To enable the project board to make key decisions and exercise overall control
options.D: To support supplier onboarding and payment

questions.correct_answer_text: To enable the project board to make key decisions and exercise overall control
questions.rationale: The purpose is to allow the project board to be accountable for the project’s success while delegating the day-to-day to the project manager. Topic 14.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of the Directing a Project process?

options.A: Provide guidance at key decision points
options.B: Make hands-on day-to-day decisions 42 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd
options.C: Authorize project initiation, stages, and closure

questions.rationale: The project board does not get involved in day-to-day project management, which is delegated to the project manager. Topic 14.1: Purpose
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following are objectives of the 'Directing a Project' process? 1. To ensure there is authority to initiate and close the project 2. To authorize each team member's daily task list 3. To ensure the business layer has a connection to the project 4. To define detailed quality criteria for specialist products
questions.rationale: The objectives include ensuring initiation and closure authority and maintaining a connection with the business layer—not daily task management. Topic 14.2: Objectives
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following is an output of the Directing a Project process?
questions.rationale: This output confirms the project board’s approval to proceed with delivery following initiation. Topic 14.2: Objectives
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: When is the 'Directing a Project' process active?

options.A: Only during project initiation and closure
options.B: From start-up to project closure, covering the entire project lifecycle
options.C: Only during delivery and stage boundaries
options.D: After the project plan has been baselined

questions.correct_answer_text: From start-up to project closure, covering the entire project lifecycle
questions.rationale: The process spans the entire project to enable the project board to oversee governance without direct involvement in execution. Topic 14.3: Context 43
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which statement best describes the level of involvement of the project board during the project?

options.A: The project board makes daily operational decisions
options.B: The project board monitors delivery by attending all team meetings
options.C: The project board exercises strategic oversight at key decision points
options.D: The project board delegates project assurance to the project manager

questions.correct_answer_text: The project board exercises strategic oversight at key decision points
questions.rationale: The project board provides oversight, authorizing stages and major exceptions, without engaging in daily detail. Topic 14.3: Context
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which activity is performed at the end of the 'Starting up a project' process and leads into 'Directing a Project'?
questions.rationale: Once preparations are complete, the project manager submits a request to initiate, which is assessed by the project board in 'Directing a Project'. Topic 14.4: Activities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO activities are part of the 'Directing a Project' process? 1. Authorize initiation 2. Authorize exception plan 3. Assign work packages 4. Create product descriptions
questions.rationale: The project board authorizes the start of the project, new stages, and exception plans. Assigning work and product planning is done by the project manager. Topic 14.4: Activities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which tailoring decision would be appropriate in a short, low-risk project regarding 'Directing a Project'? 44

options.A: Skip project board approval steps entirely
options.B: Assign all decision-making to the project manager
options.C: Combine multiple decision points into one checkpoint with written confirmation

questions.correct_answer_text: Combine multiple decision points into one checkpoint with written confirmation
questions.rationale: PRINCE2 encourages combining approval points in small projects while still retaining oversight and audit trail. Topic 14.5: Applying the Process
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which principle is most directly reinforced by the ‘Directing a Project’ process?
questions.rationale: The process empowers the project board to manage by exception—providing control while delegating day-to-day management to the project manager. Topic 14.5: Applying the Process
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Who is accountable for authorizing the closure of the project?

questions.question: Who is responsible for preparing highlight reports and submitting requests for approval?

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which practice is most involved in ensuring the project board receives updated forecasts on time and cost performance?

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO practices does the project board most rely on when deciding whether to authorize a new stage? 1. Plans 2. People 3. Business case 4. Quality

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the 'Initiating a Project' process?

options.D: To baseline product descriptions for supplier contracts

questions.correct_answer_text: To establish a solid foundation for the project before major resources are
questions.rationale: Initiation provides the structure and control necessary to ensure clarity, alignment, and commitment across the business, user, and supplier interests before full execution begins. Topic 15.1: Purpose 46

questions.question: Identify the missing word: The purpose of initiation is to confirm what needs to be done and how, before committing to significant [ ? ].

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a stated objective of the Initiating a Project process?

questions.question: What distinguishes the 'Initiating a Project' process from 'Starting up a Project'?

options.C: Initiation involves detailed planning and control arrangements
options.D: Starting up involves delivery and supplier reviews

questions.correct_answer_text: Initiation involves detailed planning and control arrangements
questions.rationale: 'Starting up a project' assesses viability; initiation prepares the full suite of plans, governance, controls, and justifications before delivery. Topic 15.3: Context

questions.question: Which PRINCE2 principle is especially relevant during initiation to ensure clarity and alignment across all stakeholders?
questions.rationale: Initiation creates the project management approach documents, clarifies accountabilities, and ensures the structure is in place for execution. Topic 15.3: Context
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which activity during initiation defines how communication with stakeholders will be managed?

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO of the following are activities within the Initiating a Project process? 1. Prepare the risk management approach 2. Assign all team members 3. Refine the business case 4. Define benefits realisation metrics

questions.question: Which principle is most directly reinforced through the creation of project governance strategies and control approaches during initiation?

questions.question: Who is responsible for preparing the management approaches and initiation documentation?

questions.question: Which TWO practices are heavily applied during Initiation to establish clear project control and direction? 1. Plans 2. Progress 3. People 4. Business Case

questions.question: Why is the quality practice important during project initiation?

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Controlling a Stage' process in PRINCE2?

options.A: To manage benefits after product delivery

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Identify the missing word: The process of 'Controlling a Stage' ensures that a stage remains within the tolerances set by the [ ? ].

options.D: It delegates approval of product descriptions to team members

options.B: The project manager escalates every issue to the project board
options.C: The project board monitors progress via reports, while the project manager handles daily control
options.D: The project board assigns specialist tasks to team members

questions.correct_answer_text: The project board monitors progress via reports, while the project manager
questions.rationale: The project board operates by exception and relies on regular highlight reports, while the project manager controls the day-to-day delivery of the stage. Topic 16.3

questions.question: Which of the following is a key benefit of the Controlling a Stage process?

questions.question: Which activity within the Controlling a Stage process is responsible for authorising a work package?

questions.question: Which tailoring option is appropriate for the Managing Product Delivery process in a small, co- located project?

questions.correct_answer_text: Use informal work packages with verbal agreements, but keep clear

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: When is the Managing a Stage Boundary process executed?

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which of the following is prepared only when a deviation from tolerance is forecast?

options.B: Work package 59 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd

questions.rationale: An exception plan is prepared if a stage or project is forecast to exceed its agreed tolerances, replacing the current plan upon approval. Topic 18.2: Objectives

questions.question: What is the main governance function of the Managing a Stage Boundary process?

options.A: To appoint a new team manager

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What document provides a summary of achievements in the current stage?

questions.question: Which activity supports planning of the next delivery stage?

questions.question: Which TWO activities are included in Managing a Stage Boundary? 1. Update the business case 60

questions.question: Which tailoring decision may be appropriate for a small project with minimal governance?

options.A: Removing the stage boundary process altogether

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which principle is most reinforced by Managing a Stage Boundary?

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Who is responsible for preparing the end stage report?

questions.question: Which practice is applied in this process to identify and record future learning?

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Closing a Project process? 62

questions.question: Which scenario would trigger the use of the Closing a Project process?

questions.question: Which statement best reflects PRINCE2’s approach to closing a project?

questions.rationale: PRINCE2 formalizes closure to ensure a clean handover, confirm completion, and capture insights for future improvement. Topic 19.3: Context

questions.question: In what situation might a project use “premature closure” procedures?

options.D: When the quality review finds a major issue

questions.correct_answer_text: When the project is no longer justified or viable
questions.rationale: A premature closure is recommended when continuing the project no longer makes sense due to changes in justification, scope, or constraints. Topic 19.3: Context

questions.question: Which TWO activities occur during project closure? 1. Prepare planned closure 2. Produce highlight reports 3. Handover products 4. Capture and review lessons
questions.rationale: During closure, the project team ensures completed products are handed over and that lessons learned are captured for future reference. Topic 19.4: Activities 64
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the purpose of the “prepare planned closure” activity?

options.A: To create a new benefits management approach
options.B: To confirm the conditions required for formal closure are met
options.C: To terminate project governance and disband all teams

questions.correct_answer_text: To confirm the conditions required for formal closure are met
questions.rationale: This activity ensures that closure prerequisites—like product acceptance and completion of required records—are in place before formal closure begins. Topic 19.4: Activities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which tailoring approach might be appropriate when closing a small, informal project?

options.A: Skip all documentation and exit directly to handover
options.B: Use simplified forms for lessons, acceptance, and handover if team members are familiar
options.C: Close the project in the initiating phase

questions.correct_answer_text: Use simplified forms for lessons, acceptance, and handover if team members are
questions.rationale: Tailoring allows for the simplification of artefacts and procedures, provided that essential outcomes like acceptance and learning are retained. Topic 19.5: Applying the Process
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which principle is most reinforced by the consistent use of project closure procedures?
questions.rationale: Project closure provides an opportunity to reflect on what worked and what didn’t— capturing lessons for use in future projects and organisational learning. Topic 19.5: Applying the Process
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Who is responsible for confirming that project products have been delivered and accepted?

options.D: Team manager 65 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd

questions.rationale: The board confirms that the project has met its objectives, products are accepted, and it is ready to be closed formally. Topic 19.6: Responsibilities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Who is responsible for preparing the end project report and closure recommendations?
questions.rationale: The project manager documents project performance, lessons learned, and closure recommendations for board review. Topic 19.6: Responsibilities
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO practices are particularly important during project closure? 1. Business case 2. Progress 3. Plans 4. People
questions.rationale: The business case is updated to reflect actual outcomes, and progress tracking supports assessment of how the project performed against the plan. Topic 19.7: Application of Practices
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which practice is applied to confirm whether acceptance criteria have been met and the product is fit for purpose?

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is a dis-benefit in PRINCE2?

options.A: An unintended advantage that results from project delivery
options.B: A forecast benefit that is no longer achievable
options.C: A measurable negative consequence of an outcome
options.D: A deviation from the project’s budget

questions.correct_answer_text: A measurable negative consequence of an outcome
questions.rationale: Dis-benefits are negative outcomes expected as a result of the project, and should be included in business case evaluation. Business Case Practice
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: Which TWO elements are included in a robust investment appraisal? 1. Payback period 2. Work package cost 3. Net present value 4. Lessons log

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

options.A: To define team structure and reporting lines
options.B: To manage procurement, contracts, and commercial risks 67 Compiled By – Himanshu Jain, DL | © Thought Agile Ltd
options.C: To set the organisation’s strategic goals

To manage procurement, contracts, and commercial risks 67

questions.question: Which TWO are core components of a plan in PRINCE2? 1. Delivery schedule 2. Exception criteria 3. Assigned responsibilities 4. External stakeholder list

source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is meant by a “planning horizon”?

options.A: The estimated cost of the next product
options.B: The point at which a project must be terminated
options.C: The timespan over which accurate planning is feasible
options.D: The highest-level view of stakeholder engagement

questions.correct_answer_text: The timespan over which accurate planning is feasible
questions.rationale: Beyond the planning horizon, uncertainty increases, and planning should be deferred to later stages. Plans Practice
source_files: Prince2 v7 Question Bank with Answers and Rationales v0.1 20250510.pdf

questions.question: What is the primary use of a product description?

questions.question: What is an off-specification?

options.B: A product that cannot be created as originally agreed

questions.question: What does PRINCE2 define as an exception?

options.A: A new product requested during the project
options.B: A deviation from tolerance levels requiring escalation
options.C: A lesson learned from a previous project
